articles.title: Daylight Savings Time Is So Bad, It's Messing With Our View of the Cosmos - Slashdot
articles.description: An anonymous reader shares a report: In a preprint titled "Can LIGO Detect Daylight Savings Time?," Reed Essick, former LIGO member and now a physicist at the University of Toronto, gives a simple answer to the paper's title: "Yes, it can." The paper, which h…
articles.content: If human activity was on a fixed time, that point in time could never be visible to astronomers, at least not unless LIGO was rebuilt on the moon. This doesn't necessarily offer benefits, but it woul… [+1096 chars]

articles.description: If you’re wondering why we haven’t met aliens, it might be because habitable zone planets just don’t get smashed almost to pieces often enough.

articles.title: Fun Fact: The Eiffel Tower was built the same year Nintendo was founded - Fox News
articles.description: Did you know that the Eiffel Tower and Nintendo were both founded in 1889, and that six U.S. state capitals lie west of Los Angeles? Learn more of our fun facts of the day!
